subtitle: This makes an interesting change to a fresh tomato sauce, but it must not be kept hanging around otherwise it will separate.

method.text: Place the pepper quarters skin side uppermost under the grill for 5-8 min or until skin has blackened and is 'blistered'. Peel off the skin and roughly chop the flesh.
Melt the butter in a frying pan. Add the onion, garlic and pepper. Fry for 2-3 min or until softened.
Transfer the onion, garlic and pepper to a food processor or blender. Process until smooth (or sieve if preferred). Return to a clean pan. Heat through gently for 2 min.
Gradually whisk in the butter until melted and smooth. Stir in the lemon juice. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

title: Red pepper sauce
